title: Teaching Language, Literature, Writing, and Culture: Topics in Pedagogy
description: This course provides an intensive graduate-level pedagogy course that discusses the relevant literature in teaching language, literature, writing, and culture at the university level. Students will learn best practices in pedagogy and, through various projects, will prepare to apply these practices in a classroom setting. Topics may vary and include: introduction to pedagogy, critical pedagogies, critical language awareness, anti-racist/inclusive approaches to teaching, assessment, and literacy. May be taken up to three times for credit. Restricted to major codes LT77, LT84, and LT85.
